intro: Zygophyllidum delicatulum, commonly known as the delicate zygophyll, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae, which is characterized by its small, often spiny leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, shrub-like perennial with woody stems and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Zygophyllidum delicatulum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying desert flora.
